intro: Erythraea macrantha var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered erythraea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It produces small, round berries that contain seeds, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
